intro: Sida hermannioides, commonly known as Hermann's sida, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, woolly leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sida hermannioides is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
